chapter.title: Updating Basics
chapter.para: This chapter shows you how to update an OpenAM server. Starting with OpenAM 10.0.0 and later versions, OpenAM supports schema changes as part of an update, so you may need to run the upgrade wizard at the end of the update process. The wizard will automatically write all necessary changes to the configuration store and will prompt you to restart the container.

There are two ways to update your deployment: using the defaults and adding the customized files. You should try the default update in a test environment before you apply it to a production environment. ForgeRock also recommends working on the customized version in a test environment before updating a productions version so that you will be aware of any potential issues that you may encounter with your customized version.
These instructions are good for updates from OpenAM 9.5 to any later OpenAM 9.X release, and updates from 10.0.0 to any later OpenAM 10.x release.

step.para: Verify that the JAVA_HOME is properly set.
Backup the file system directory for the current deployment.
If you have multiple instances deployed, all instances must be running when you backup.
If you have multiple instances deployed, all instances must be running when you backup.
Export the configuration backend where OpenAM configuration data is stored. By default the base DN for the backend is .
Stop OpenAM, or if necessary to redeploy OpenAM, stop the container where OpenAM is running.
If you have multiple instance, you will need to deploy the update .war file for all of your OpenAM instances.
For the first instance, follow the instructions in the upgrade wizard if you are applying updates to OpenAM 10.0.0 or later.
If you downloaded the .zip file to update the tools, reinstall them.

example.title: Updating to OpenAM 10.1.0 Xpress
example.para: The following example updates OpenAM 10.0.0 to OpenAM 10.1.0 Xpress on an Ubuntu instance using Apache Tomcat. The example only addresses the .war file. Review the Installation Guide to reinstall the tools following a successful update.
Your port numbers and directory names may be different than the ones used in the example. Also, make sure to use your password where applicable.
If you have multiple instances, make sure they are all running during the backup process.

listitem.para: Verify that the JAVA_HOME is properly set.

listitem.screen: $ cd /path/to/ssoadm-home/openam/bin $ ./ssoadm export -svc-cfg --adminid amadmin --password-file path/to/password/file --encryptsecret mySeretEncryptionKey --outfile openam-config-export.xml

listitem.para: Export the configuration backend/DN from the directory server.

listitem.screen:
$ cd /path/to/tomcat $ ./bin/shutdown.sh
Password: Using CATALINA_BASE: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_HOME: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_TMPDIR: /path/to/tomcat/temp Using JRE_HOME: /path/to/jdk1.6/jre Using CLASSPATH: /path/to/tomcat/bin/bootstrap.jar
$ cd /path/to/tomcat/webapps $ rm -rf openam $ rm openam.war $ rm -rf /path/to/tomcat/work/Catalina/localhost/openam $ cp /path/to/expanded-openam-war/update-war/openam.war .

listitem.para: In your browser, go to your instance of OpenAM and follow the instructions in the upgrade wizard.

textobject.para: The initial upgrade screen lets you choose to upgrade or to restore the configuration.
The initial upgrade screen lets you choose to upgrade or to restore the configuration.

listitem.para:
Reinstall any tools you would like to have with the updated version of OpenAM. Refer to the
Installation Guide if you are unsure how to reinstall the tools.

example.para: Once you have verified that the deployment is complete, you can go back and delete the directories your created to expand the .war files.
